text:
Robin DiAngelo’s 2018 book “White Fragility” argues that our segregated society is set up to insulate whites from racial discomfort, so that they fall to pieces at the first application of stress.

text: “In Iceland it has been run entirely by the public-health authorities,” one neurologist said, of the country’s coronavirus response. “We were fortunate that our politicians managed to control themselves.” https://t.co/x727CSG1rK

text: In her new photo series, “Behind Glass,” Lisa Sorgini seeks to honor mothers and their children; the title refers not only to isolation but also to Sorgini’s wish to elevate her subjects, to place them on a pedestal. https://t.co/Gt7adctQ2T

text: "There’s no way restaurants are going to be able to open and maintain the staffing levels they had before COVID," the chef and TV personality Tom Colicchio says. What will it take to keep restaurants afloat, not just through the shutdown, but after it? https://t.co/TU2SszxG1M

text: In several cases that will come before the Supreme Court in the coming months, the public’s ability to seek accountability for misconduct is at stake. But, more important, the cases represent a gut check for our system of separation of powers. https://t.co/Zx07GWHyZs
